greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A278222(A336120(i)) = A278222(A336120(j)) for all i, j >= 1.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of A278222(A336120(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A253553(n) = if(n<=2,1,my(f=factor(n), k=#f~); if(f[k,2]>1,f[k,2]--,f[k,1] = precprime(f[k,1]-1)); factorback(f));
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ From A046523
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 17 2020
